thread.title: Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns
thread.title_full: Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns

author: BERNIE WILSON
title: Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns
text:
Denis Poroy Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns 
San Diego Chargers kicker Josh Lambo (2) celebrates his NFL football game-winning field goal against the Cleveland Browns during the second half Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in San Diego. (AP Photo/Denis Poroy) Lenny Ignelzi Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns 
San Diego Chargers kicker Josh Lambo (2) watches his NFL football game-winning field goal against the Cleveland Browns during the second half Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in San Diego. (AP Photo/Lenny Ignelzi) Denis Poroy Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns 
San Diego Chargers kicker Josh Lambo (2) celebrates his game-winning field goal against the Cleveland Browns during the second half in an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in San Diego. (AP Photo/Denis Poroy) Denis Poroy Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns 
Cleveland Browns running back Isaiah Crowell (34) stays inbounds after getting past San Diego Chargers cornerback Brandon Flowers (24) during the second half in an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in San Diego. (AP Photo/Denis Poroy) Lenny Ignelzi Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns 
Cleveland Browns quarterback Josh McCown (13) is hit by San Diego Chargers outside linebacker Kyle Emanuel as he throws a pass during the second half in an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in San Diego. (AP Photo/Lenny Ignelzi) Denis Poroy Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns 
San Diego Chargers wide receiver Steve Johnson (11) cannot make the catch as Cleveland Browns cornerback Tramon Williams applies pressure during the first half in an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in San Diego. (AP Photo/Denis Poroy) Posted: Monday, October 5, 2015 2:43 am Lambo's FG as time expires lifts Chargers over Browns Associated Press | 0 comments 
SAN DIEGO (AP) — A combination of Philip Rivers' veteran grit and rookie Josh Lambo's second-chance field goal got the San Diego Chargers back on track. 
Given a second chance because of a penalty, Lambo kicked a 34-yard field as time expired to lift the Chargers to a 30-27 victory against the Cleveland Browns on Sunday.
